729604f-a.title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Swan Street
729604f-a.text:
119 St. Pauls Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Swan
Street. Mr. Sperr states that this is supposed to be
the house in which Richard Adams Locke, who wrote
''Moon Hoax'' (N.Y. Sun, August, 1835), lived for a time.
The house was owned in 187d (Beers's map) by D. B.
Williamson.
October 22, 1926
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCCTIONS
729604f-a.folder: St. Pauls Avenue & Swan Street, Staten Island, NY
